oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1958-10-18 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from October 18, 1958 (although the label is dated October 17, 1958, this is likely incorrect). Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Cowboy Copas (host/performer), guest performer Kitty Wells, and regular performers the Jordanaires, Tommy Jackson, Hank Garland, Archie Campbell, Del Wood, and Randy Hughes. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 993rd broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Cowboy Copas; Jordanaires; Kitty Wells; Tommy Jackson; Hank Garland
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Cowboy Copas -- Down In Nashville, Tennessee (Cowboy Copas) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Cowboy Copas) -- Cowboy Copas introduces the Jordanaires -- This Little Light Of Mine (Jordanaires) -- Cowboy Copas introduces Kitty Wells -- He's Lost His Love For Me (Kitty Wells) -- Prince Albert commercial (Cowboy Copas, Grant Turner) -- Cowboy Copas introduces Tommy Jackson -- Bill Cheatham (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Cowboy Copas talks -- The Man Upstairs (Cowboy Copas, Jordanaires) -- Cowboy Copas introduces Hank Garland -- Big Guitar (Hank Garland) -- Cowboy Copas talks
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Turner, Grant; Campbell, Archie; Wood, Del; Jackson, Tommy; Jordanaires (Musical group); Stoker, Gordon, 1924-2013; Garland, Hank, 1930-2004; Hughes, Randy, 1928-1963; Copas, Cowboy; Wells, Kitty
